tasks.title: Fix Telegram voice messaging
tasks.description: Voice messages currently crash OpenClaw. Need to investigate and fix the crash issue to make voice messaging stable and reliable.

comments.author: OpenClaw
comments.text: Root cause: OOM killer terminating gateway when whisper loads model. Server has 3.8GB RAM, no swap. Fix: switched to tiny model (73MB vs 139MB base). Config updated and gateway restarted.

comments.author: OpenClaw
comments.text: Voice message test successful! Received and transcribed without crash. Tiny model fix confirmed working.

tasks.title: Fix Voice Message Gateway Crashes
tasks.description: After 2-3 voice messages, gateway becomes unresponsive and requires restart. Investigate memory/context issues with voice message processing. CRITICAL PRIORITY.

comments.author: OpenClaw
comments.text: Updated OpenClaw from 2026.1.30 to 2026.2.2-3. This version includes fix #7475 'Media understanding: skip binary media from file text extraction' which should address the voice message context overflow issue.

comments.author: OpenClaw
comments.text: Stability test in progress: 6/10 voice messages processed successfully with no crashes. Update to 2026.2.2-3 appears to have fixed the issue.

comments.author: OpenClaw
comments.text: STABILITY TEST PASSED: 10/10 voice messages processed successfully including a 2.5 minute stress test. Update to 2026.2.2-3 confirmed to fix the binary media context overflow issue. Ready for final approval.

tasks.title: Token Usage Tracking & Cost Visualization
tasks.description:
OBJECTIVE: Build a LIVE token usage tracking system with cost visualization for GitHub Copilot billing

EXPECTATIONS FROM ANTHONY:
- Track total token usage over time with visual chart - LIVE updates
- Show cost per task/agent breakdown (which work consumes most tokens)
- Hierarchical breakdown: Heartbeat vs Tasks vs Ad-hoc conversations
- Display BOTH tokens AND estimated cost
- All visualizations must auto-refresh (within 30 seconds)
- Token Tracking is a NEW dedicated page in Agent Activity Monitor
- Update ACTIVE AGENTS page to show tokens + cost per agent
- Update HISTORY page to show tokens + cost for historical agents
- THREE visualization types: Line chart (over time), Stacked bar (per-task), Treemap (hierarchical)
- **BASELINE TRACKING**: Store a "starting balance" value provided by Anthony from GitHub billing
- **CUMULATIVE COST**: Add tracked costs to the baseline, so total shown matches GitHub billing
- **PREDICTION ACCURACY**: When Anthony checks GitHub billing, the value should match what's displayed
- **BILLING CYCLE RESET**: Support monthly reset when billing cycle completes (Anthony will notify)

CONSTRAINTS:
- Use GitHub Copilot billing rates (must research exact per-model costs)
- Must handle multiple models: Opus ($15/$75), Sonnet ($3/$15), GPT-4o ($2.50/$10), GPT-4o-mini ($0.15/$0.60), Gemini Pro ($1.25/$5)
- Integrate with existing Agent Activity Monitor (monitor_server.py)

DELIVERABLES:
1. Token logging infrastructure capturing per-request usage
2. NEW dedicated Token Tracking page in Activity Monitor with 3 visualizations
3. Updated Active Agents page with tokens + cost per agent
4. Updated History page with tokens + cost for historical agents
5. Live auto-refresh (30 second intervals)
6. **Baseline cost storage** - ability to set starting balance from GitHub billing
7. **Cumulative total display** - baseline + tracked usage = total shown
8. Cost prediction that matches GitHub billing

SUCCESS CRITERIA:
- Can see at a glance: total spend, per-agent breakdown, per-task costs
- Refresh within 30 seconds shows updated data
- Anthony provides baseline, tracks for days, checks GitHub - values match
- Monthly reset capability when Anthony notifies of new billing cycle

subtasks.title: Research GitHub Copilot token pricing - confirm rates per model
Design token logging schema: task_id, agent_id, model, input_tokens, output_tokens, timestamp
Implement token tracking hooks in OpenClaw (capture per-request)
Build cost calculation engine - apply correct rate per model
Create NEW Token Tracking page in monitor_server.py
Add LINE CHART - total usage over time with cost overlay
Add STACKED BAR CHART - per-task breakdown with cost labels
Add TREEMAP/SUNBURST - hierarchical breakdown (Heartbeat/Tasks/Ad-hoc)
Update ACTIVE AGENTS page - show tokens + cost per agent card
Update AGENT HISTORY page - show tokens + cost for historical agents
Implement auto-refresh (30 second intervals) for all views
Add Token Tracking nav link to all pages in Activity Monitor
Test and calibrate cost estimates against actual GitHub billing
Add baseline cost storage (JSON file with starting_balance, date_set, cycle_start)
Create /set-baseline endpoint to accept Anthony's GitHub billing value
Update Token Tracking page: show baseline + tracked = total
Add 'Reset for New Billing Cycle' button/endpoint
Show model rate ($/M tokens) on agent cards in Dashboard and History pages
Add Token Tracking button to Activity Monitor navigation (📊 💰 style)
Implement line chart showing cost over time

tasks.title: Mission Control: Last Updated Timestamps + Auto-Sort by Recent
tasks.description:
OBJECTIVE: Show last updated time on task cards and sort by most recently updated

EXPECTATIONS FROM ANTHONY:
- Every task card on dashboard shows "Updated: X time ago" or "Updated: 1:45 PM" BEFORE opening
- When ANY change happens to a task (subtask added/crossed off, comment added, status change), timestamp updates
- Tasks within each column (backlog, in_progress, review) sorted by MOST RECENTLY UPDATED at top
- I can see at a glance which tasks are being actively worked on
- Agent MUST add a comment whenever crossing off subtasks, adding subtasks, or making any change
- This behavior must be HARDCODED into identity files (HEARTBEAT.md, AGENTS.md, SOUL.md)
- Must create a SKILL that enforces this behavior for future reference

CONSTRAINTS:
- Must work with existing Mission Control dashboard
- Must update in real-time with auto-refresh
- Sorting must be per-column (not global)

DELIVERABLES:
1. Dashboard update: Show "Updated: [timestamp]" on each task card (visible without clicking)
2. Dashboard update: Sort tasks within each column by lastUpdated descending (newest first)
3. mc CLI update: Ensure every operation updates the lastUpdated field
4. Identity file updates: HEARTBEAT.md, AGENTS.md, SOUL.md - hardcode the rule to always add comments on changes
5. Create skill or script that documents/enforces this behavior
6. Auto-comment on subtask changes (when crossing off, adding, or modifying subtasks)

SUCCESS CRITERIA:
- Anthony can see which tasks were updated most recently without opening them
- Most recently updated tasks float to top of each column
- Every subtask change triggers a comment explaining what changed
- Agent behavior is hardcoded - never forgets to update timestamps and add comments

Update mc CLI to set lastUpdated on every operation

Update SOUL.md - add rule to always comment on changes
Create skill/script documenting this behavior
Test: verify subtask changes trigger comments and timestamp updates
Test: mc CLI now updates lastUpdated on every operation

tasks.title: Research GitHub Copilot Pro+ Billing & Fix Token Tracking Accuracy
tasks.description:
OBJECTIVE: Deep research into GitHub Copilot Pro+ plan billing mechanics and fix token tracking to accurately predict costs

EXPECTATIONS FROM ANTHONY:
1. RESEARCH DELIVERABLES:
   - How many tokens/premium requests included in Pro+ plan ($40/month)?
   - When do additional charges start?
   - How is token usage cost calculated?
   - When does billing cycle start/end?
   - How do premium request multipliers work (Opus 3x, Sonnet 1x, GPT-4o free)?
   - What counts as a 'premium request'?
   - Full understanding of the billing model

2. FIX CURRENT ISSUES:
   - Current tracking shows Opus at $100+ which is INACCURATE
   - When user enters GitHub balance, RESET all prior usage tracking
   - Only count usage FROM that point forward
   - Clear explanation of discrepancy between our estimates and actual billing

3. IMPLEMENTATION PLAN:
   - How to accurately predict costs based on our token tracking
   - How to align our tracking with GitHub's billing model
   - Account for included allowance before extra charges kick in

CONSTRAINTS:
- Research must be thorough and accurate
- Must understand the ACTUAL billing model, not assumptions
- PDF report required

DELIVERABLES:
1. PDF research report answering ALL questions above
2. Explanation of current tracking inaccuracy
3. Implementation plan for accurate cost prediction
4. Clear baseline reset mechanism design

SUCCESS CRITERIA:
- Anthony fully understands how Pro+ billing works
- Token tracking accurately predicts actual GitHub charges
- Baseline reset clears old data and counts fresh

subtasks.title: Research: GitHub Copilot Pro+ plan details - included allowance, pricing tiers
Research: Premium request multipliers - what models cost what
Research: Billing cycle mechanics - when charges start, how calculated
Research: What counts as a premium request vs free request
Analyze: Why current tracking shows $100+ for Opus (inaccurate)
Design: Baseline reset mechanism - clear old usage when balance entered
Design: Accurate cost prediction algorithm aligned with GitHub billing
Deliverable: Write comprehensive PDF research report
Deliverable: Implementation plan for Activity Monitor fixes

comments.author: OpenClaw
comments.text: Starting research task. 9 subtasks created. Will research GitHub Copilot Pro+ billing thoroughly, identify why current tracking is inaccurate, and design fixes. Spawning research sub-agent.

comments.author: OpenClaw
comments.text: Spawned task-019-research (Sonnet) to do deep research on GitHub Copilot Pro+ billing. Will search official docs, pricing pages, and billing documentation. Research files will be saved to /root/.openclaw/workspace/research/github-copilot-billing/

comments.author: OpenClaw
comments.text: Research sub-agent appears stuck (0 tokens, timeout on status check). Killing and respawning.

comments.author: OpenClaw
comments.text: Respawned as task-019-research-v2 (Sonnet). Monitoring.

comments.author: OpenClaw
comments.text: Research complete (sub_001-sub_005). KEY FINDING: GitHub does NOT bill per-token! It bills per PREMIUM REQUEST with model multipliers. Opus 4.5 = 3x, Sonnet = 1x, GPT-4o = FREE. Pro+ includes 1,500 premium requests/month. Overages = $0.04/request. Our current $100+ estimate was using wrong methodology (per-token instead of per-request). Now working on baseline reset design and implementation plan.

comments.author: OpenClaw
comments.text: PDF report created: /root/.openclaw/workspace/research/github-copilot-billing/report.pdf (52KB). All research complete. 9/9 subtasks done. Ready for review.

tasks.description:
OBJECTIVE: Update all configuration and identity files to enforce github-copilot/claude-haiku-4.5 for main session and all sub-agents

EXPECTATIONS FROM ANTHONY:
- Main session: always use haiku
- All sub-agents: always spawn with haiku
- Gateway config: default model set to haiku
- No overrides, no exceptions
- Cost control priority

CONSTRAINTS:
- Use FULL model name: github-copilot/claude-haiku-4.5 (never alias)
- Update: HEARTBEAT.md, SOUL.md, AGENTS.md, gateway config, session defaults

DELIVERABLES:
- All identity files updated with haiku as mandatory default
- Gateway config patched with haiku as default_model
- Sub-agent spawn rules updated to force haiku model

SUCCESS CRITERIA:
- Every new sub-agent spawns with haiku automatically
- Main session locked to haiku
- No manual override possible

tasks.title: Refine Token Tracker Accuracy: Cost Sync with GitHub Billing
tasks.description:
OBJECTIVE: Update Activity Monitor token tracker to achieve 100% accuracy with GitHub Copilot Pro+ billing by implementing real-time cost sync, model rate verification, session-level cost attribution, and continuous calibration.

EXPECTATIONS FROM ANTHONY:
- Track every token (in/out) with precise cost calculation using GitHub Copilot Pro+ rates
- Sync tracked costs with GitHub billing dashboard monthly for verification
- Show cost breakdown by model, session, task with confidence metrics
- Flag cost discrepancies >5% with investigation recommendations
- Implement automatic rate updates when GitHub changes Pro+ pricing
- Support multiple billing cycles with baseline reset capability
- Dashboard must show: actual cost, tracked cost, variance, calibration status

CONSTRAINTS:
- Use ONLY GitHub Copilot Pro+ pricing (no fallback to estimates)
- Track at request level (not session level) for precision
- GitHub billing data updates on schedule - sync accordingly
- Handle incomplete billing data gracefully (transactions pending)
- Maintain backward compatibility with existing 20 subtasks

DELIVERABLES:
- Request-level cost tracking schema (capture rate_per_token at request time)
- GitHub billing API integration for cost verification
- Enhanced Dashboard page: actual vs tracked cost comparison
- Cost variance report (monthly reconciliation)
- Automatic rate update mechanism for GitHub Pro+ pricing changes
- Calibration history log (when baseline adjusted, by how much)

SUCCESS CRITERIA:
- Tracked costs match GitHub billing within 2% (not 5%)
- Dashboard shows live variance alerts
- Monthly sync process automated or one-click
- All 3 visualizations updated to use precise rates
- Cost attribution 100% to originating session/model/task

subtasks.title: Extract GitHub Pro+ rates from report: confirm $/M input vs output per model
Design request-level cost tracking: capture rate_per_token at request time (not retroactive)
Update token logging schema: add request_id, actual_cost_usd, cost_calculated_at_timestamp
Implement GitHub billing API integration: fetch monthly spend from Copilot dashboard
Create cost reconciliation engine: compare tracked vs GitHub billing, flag variance >2%
Update Dashboard page: show Actual GitHub Cost | Tracked Cost | Variance % | Last Sync
Update all 3 visualizations (bar, treemap, line) to use request-level actual costs
Implement automatic rate updater: monitor GitHub pricing, update rates config on change
Build monthly calibration report: reconciliation history, adjustments made, confidence trend
Add cost attribution by session/model/task: drill-down from total to individual request
Test: validate tracked costs match GitHub billing within 2% for current cycle
Deploy: update monitor_server.py, token tracking endpoints, cost reconciliation cron
